title: About
text:
I am a Vermonter through and through. I grew up in Northern Vermont and got my Bachelors of Science in Mathematics at the Saint Michael’s College. After graduating, I jumped right into my graduate studies at the University of Vermont in the Mathematical Science Ph.D. program and within the Vermont Complex Systems Center.

When I am not at my laptop or reading papers, you can find me either in the mountains, where I am hiking or skiing, or at a Crossfit class.

title: Welcome!
text: I am a fourth year Mathematical Sciences Ph.D. student in the Joint Lab and Computational Story Lab at the Vermont Complex Systems Center at the University of Vermont (UVM). My research has mostly focused on network science applied to biology. This lead me in the direction of mathematical methods for networks, specifically stochastic models that involve branching processes.

title: Welcome!
text:
Research Interests

Mathematical models for complex systems
Network science
Stochastic modeling
Disease dynamics
